Bash(# Create Features 1-4 in parallel
az boards work-item create \
  --type ""Feature"" \
  --title ""Problem-Focused Core Module Documentation"" \
  --description ""$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
Enhance core/CLAUDE.md to explain what problems each module solves, not just what it does.

## User Story
As an AI agent working on core modules, I want CLAUDE.md files that explain what problems each module solves (not just what it does), so that I align my code changes with the project''s reliability goals.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] core/CLAUDE.md explains state_manager.py solves ''workflow fragility'' and ''memory limitations'' from VISION.md
- [ ] core/CLAUDE.md explains profiler.py enables visibility into AI agent performance costs and bottlenecks
- [ ] core/CLAUDE.md explains context_loader.py solves ''context overload'' by loading only relevant context
- [ ] Each component description starts with the problem it solves, then explains how
- [ ] CLAUDE.md is standalone - doesn''t just redirect to README.md

## Business Value
HIGH - Core modules are the foundation. If AI doesn''t understand why state management exists (making failures recoverable), it will implement features that bypass checkpointing.

## Technical Details
- Modules: state_manager.py, profiler.py, context_loader.py, directed_loader.py
- Estimated: 3 story points

## Dependencies
- E2: Documentation Generation Templates

  --type ""Feature"" \
  --title ""Problem-Focused Adapter Module Documentation"" \
  --description ""$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary
Enhance adapters/CLAUDE.md to explain why external work tracking is the source of truth.

## User Story
As an AI agent working on platform adapters, I want adapters/CLAUDE.md to explain why external work tracking is the source of truth (preventing AI from hallucinating task completion), so that I do not add features that bypass work item verification.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] adapters/azure_devops/CLAUDE.md explains adapters implement ''external source of truth'' principle
- [ ] Documentation clarifies work tracking system is source of truth, not AI conversation
- [ ] Explains why verification queries work tracking system, not state files
- [ ] Shows how adapters implement ''Pillar 2: Verifiable Workflows'' via external validation
- [ ] Includes guidance on maintaining verification rigor when adding new adapters

## Business Value
MEDIUM - Adapters enable external verification. Misunderstanding here impacts specific integrations rather than framework-wide reliability.

## Technical Details
- Azure DevOps adapter (1,866 LOC) and file-based adapter
- File-based adapter needs documentation parity
- Estimated: 3 story points

## Dependencies
- E2: Documentation Generation Templates

Bash(# Create User Stories for Feature 1001 (Documentation System)
# US-1: Standards and Templates
az boards work-item create \
  --type ""Task"" \
  --title ""Establish Documentation Standards and Templates"" \
  --description ""$(cat <<''EOF''
## User Story
As a Framework Developer, I want a standardized schema for CLAUDE.md front matter and problem-focused documentation templates, so that all documentation follows a consistent structure that emphasizes problems solved over features described.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Front matter schema is defined with required fields: purpose, problem_solved, keywords, task_types
- [ ] Documentation generation templates exist for different module types (core, agent, workflow, adapter, config)
- [ ] Templates include sections: Problem Statement, Solution Approach, Usage Patterns, Dependencies, Architecture
- [ ] Schema validation can detect CLAUDE.md files missing required fields or using feature-focused language
- [ ] Templates are stored in templates/documentation/ and can be rendered with project context

## Business Value
HIGH - Foundation story. This is the meta-structure that all other documentation will follow.

## Technical Notes
Consolidates items 987 (schema) and 988 (templates). Should define what ''problem-focused'' means with examples. Schema should be enforceable via CLI validation.

## Story Points
5
